# hourCycle

**Instance Property**

The hour cycle used by the locale, like one-to-twelve or zero-to-twenty-three.

## Declaration

```swift
var hourCycle: Locale.HourCycle { get }
```

## Discussion

When called on the special [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale] instances [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/current] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/autoupdatingCurrent], if the user overrode the default hour cycle, this property provides the user’s preference.

This property corresponds to the `hc` key of the Unicode BCP 47 extension.

For locale instances created with the `hc` specifier (such as `en-US@hc=h23`), or with a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components], this property represents the custom hour cycle. Otherwise, it represents the locale’s default hour cycle.

## Getting date and time components

- **firstDayOfWeek**: The first day of the week as represented by this locale.
- **Locale.Weekday**: A type that represents weekdays, used for indicating a locale’s first day of the week.
- **Locale.HourCycle**: A type that represents the hour cycle used in a locale, like one-to-twelve or zero-to-twenty-three.
- **timeZone**: The time zone associated with the locale, if any.
